question: The (EcAMSat) mission, sometimes seen in the news, aims to:
option1: identify the intensity of Galactic cosmic rays (GCR) that penetrate the moon surface
option2: investigate the spaceflight effects on bacterial antibiotic resistance
option3: establish two way optical communications for deep space.
option4: study the terrain mapping and make an analysis of soil on the surface of Jupiter
answer: investigate the spaceflight effects on bacterial antibiotic resistance
explanation: EcAMSat stands for E.coli Antimicrobial Satellite. This mission will investigate space microgravity effects on the antibiotic resistance of E. coli, a bacterial pathogen responsible for urinary tract infection in humans and animals. It has been developed through a partnership between NASAâ€™s Ames Research Center and the Stanford University School of Medicine. The mission is funded as part of the Space Biology Project at NASA Ames Research Center.
